definitions.definition: The property of being thick (in dimension).
A measure of how thick (in dimension) something is.
examples: The thickness of the Earth's crust varies from two to 70 kilometres.
Guitar picks come in different thicknesses .
We upholstered the seat with three thicknesses of cloth to make it more comfortable to sit on.

definitions.definition: The quality of being thick (in consistency).
examples: Whip the cream until it reaches a good thickness .

definitions.definition: The property of being thick (slow to understand).
The minimum number of planar subgraphs which a given graph can decompose into.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) The property of being thick (in dimension).
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable , countable ) A measure of how thick (in dimension) something is.
( uncountable ) The quality of being thick (in consistency).
( uncountable , informal ) The property of being thick (slow to understand).
( graph theory , countable ) The minimum number of planar subgraphs which a given graph can decompose into.
